reviews.title: clean, but slightly pricey
reviews.text: I stayed here in June 2003 for two nights. It is only 2 minutes from the airport. The room is clean. There is complementary breakfast and internet access in the lobby. They do offer you free bottled water if you ask for it at the reception. The staff is friendly. The hotel is a little on the pricey side. If you are there making Hilton Honors points or your travel destinations are near the airport, it's an acceptable option. There are other cheaper hotels in the area.

Hampton Inns are usually a safe bet. This one is no different. Clean room and common areas, cheery staff, decent enough breakfast included, 2 computers for guest use. Free airport shuttle (or anywhere within a 3-mile radius). Ask for a room on an upper floor and on the fairgrounds side of the building (away from interstate). I didn't have an issue with the room being noisy, other than the usual--water running in room next door, people talking in hallway.
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on our way to Memphis as an overnight stop. The staff were very courteous and the room was very well appointed, very clean and the beds were quite comfortable. Although the hotel is near the airport. I only heard one airplane during the night. We had the room closest to the front desk and breakfast area, so the microwave beeping during use was audible throughout the night at various intervals. Additionally, the ice machine and vending area was next to our room so that is also a consideration if staying there to try and select your room away from these areas if possible. As we were just stopping in with no prior reservation, we pretty much had to take what was available and by the look of the parking lot the hotel was probably rather full the day we stayed there. We did not have a Laptop computer with us so I can not comment on the availability of the wireless Internet service, and I do not know if a computer is available for guest use (I did not see one at this Hampton Inn but did at another one we stayed at later). If you will be traveling, I would highly suggest taking a laptop if you have one, or if not, then buying one to take with you. We REALLY could have used one on our trip. I looked for the exercise room as described but could not find it, although I did not search out the entire hotel, just where the provided hotel map stated it should be. The morning breakfast was fine as far as we were concerned, but we do not eat a huge breakfast when traveling. it consisted of the usual fare of cold cereals, an assortment of baked goods such as bagels, white and wheat bread, muffins etc. along with what appeared to be egg and cheese omelets. My wife was particularly pleased that they had Activia yogurt available. There are apparently no eating establishments available within walking distance, but we had a fast dinner meal at the McDonald's just down the street. I imagine if you have a GPS unit when traveling that you could easily locate many other places to eat by using the Point of Interest option on the GPS unit. We did this in another city and it worked out very well. Overall we were very well pleased with this hotel and if I was in this area again I would definitely stay here in the future.
reviews.title: We'll be staying at Hampton Inns again
Basic Hampton Inn
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in August 2008. Its a basic, no frills Hampton Inn, the same one's you'd expect to get in every American City. Nothing here really stands out. The one thing to note is that Louisville Airport is a UPS hub, so given this hotels proximity to the airport, you get a LOT of planes flying in and out all night long. The first 3 nights I didn't hear a thing, but the last night, it kept me up all night long as I heard the planes rumble. (I assumed they must be using a different runway, or taking off in the opposite direction on that last night).
Truth be told, you just need to crank up your A/C and you can't hear the planes anymore, but it was kind of a pain.
reviews.title: Ok if you need be in the area

reviews.text: All-in-all, its a decent place to grab a night's rest, although next time I'd try to stay further away from the airport.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, Very accommodating
Very Nice Hotel!
reviews.text: I wa very leary about booking and staying at another Hampton Inn because of other experiences that I have had there- meager accomodations, horrible decor. When I checked in, the staff was very friendly, but when I got to my room that was the shocker. It reminded me of a room that I had booked at the Hyatt or the Marriott or even an upscale Hilton. The decore was very classy, the beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was huge and decorated beautifully. I would recommend this hotel to any business traveler for a long term or short term stay. Now granted, you must travel a bit to get to any of the local restaurants because there are none next door or nearby within walking distance, but the location is good.. Right next to the freeway, and the airport.

I spent two nights here recently and was happy enough. The room is showing some wear and needs to be updated soon but was OK. The room was quite small too. I wanted to stay at the Hilton Garden hotel nearby but they were booked up. I feel kind of sorry for these older motels- there's a lot of competition from newer properties. Naturally, everyone wants to stay at a new place. Hoteliers need to be vigilant in maintaining and updating.
reviews.title: OK
Nice hotel
reviews.text: I also enjoyed the use of the computers and printer. Many businessmen were staying here. The warm cookies in the evening were a nice touch.

A very helpful evening desk clerk steered me to a tasty, informal Asian restaurant one exit away (Vietnamese Kitchen)- I don't like most chain restaurants and the food was quite good here although the decor was funky- definitely not upscale and would not appeal to everyone.
reviews.title: Great Place
Wonderful Hotel!
reviews.text: As far as breakfasts go at these places, basically it's very mediocre with awful bread and pastries. The juice and cold cereal are about the only acceptable choices in my opinion. I also won't drink the coffee and instead have hot tea and wait for better coffee later. All the businessmen were gobbling it down and looked very happy though.

likes.disliked: — inability to sleep do to noise

reviews.text: Not all airports have a quite period in the middle of the night, even in Louisville, Kentucky. There were flights all night , at least 3 per hour!!! May have been Military??
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: Most importantly, not all airport hotels are built with some degree of sound proofing. It was unbearable.
reviews.title: the photos do not do this hotel justice!!!

reviews.text: Everything else could have been 5 STAR, but if you check into a hotel and you can't sleep, nothing else matters, period.
reviews.title: Good Location, staff friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before an early flight out of Louisville. We were pleasantly surprised to see that the hotel was newly remodeled.
reviews.title: We got our money back.
